intro: Cephalaria bigazzii, commonly known as the alpine cephalaria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its flowers are usually yellow or white, and it produces fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. Cephalaria bigazzii is often found in high-altitude meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
